div.l: His name was y hote deynus Symkyn
A wyf he had come of noble kyn
The ꝑpersone of the towne hir fader was
Wᵗith hir he yaue many a panne of bras
For that Symkyn shuld in his blode alye
She was fostrede in a nonrye
For Symkyn wold no wiff as he seide
But yf she were welle y noryshede ⁊and a mayde
To saue his astate of yomanrye
And she was prowde and pert as a pye
A fulle feire sight was vppon hem two
An holyday before hir wold he go
Wᵗith his tipett ybounde aboute his hede
And she came aftir in a gite of rede
And Symkyn had hosen of the same
There durst no wight clepe hir but dame
Was none so hardy that went by the wey
That with hir durste ones rage or pley
But yf he wold be slayn of Symkyn
Wᵗith panade or wᵗith knyff or bodekyn
For iolous folke ben ꝑperlous euermo
Algates they wold her wyues wenten so
And eke also for she was somdele smotirliche
She was as dyne as watir as watir as watir on the diche
And fulle of hocour as a pismare
Here thought a lady shold hir spare
Whate for her kynrede and hir nortery
That she had lerned in the Nonnry
A doughter had they betwix hem two
Of twanty yere withouten eny mo
Savynge a childe that of halfe yere age
In cradil it lay and was a propir page
This wenche thick and welle I growe was
Wᵗith camoyse nose and eyen grey as glas
